page.title: 16ATTITUDES
page.content: ATTITUDES There is some concern over the use of Bridle Paths and footpaths in the area as walkers and ramblers sometimes stray from the designated area into the fields. Some villagers, mainly parents and teenagers would like to see a play area and Youth Club in existence. Parts of the area are without mains water and this is something that residents would like to be installed. There has recently been a leakage from a lagoon at Aston which resulted in pollution of the River and the death of all the fish. As the public services are not the same throughout the area, some residents would like a weekly refuse collection. These are only minor irritations and there is a general feeling of satisfaction with the village and the amenities currently provided.
